poem:
The Engine of Growth

Past's whispers shape the now—  
Investment, the seed,  
grows into branches,  
criss-crossing skies of hope.  
Old roads echo wooden wheels,  
sparks of state-kindled fires,  
luring future's hand.  
Astonished we watch—  
ivy climbing quiet walls  
where dreams double,  
towering to touch tomorrow.
